message_1: What is the enthalpy change of ionization for a solution containing 0.1 mol of HCl (aq) if 20 kJ of heat is absorbed during the ionization process?
message_2:
To calculate the enthalpy change of ionization, we need to divide the heat absorbed by the number of moles of the substance.

Enthalpy change of ionization (ΔH) = Heat absorbed (q) / Number of moles (n)

ΔH = 20 kJ / 0.1 mol

ΔH = 200 kJ/mol

The enthalpy change of ionization for the solution containing 0.1 mol of HCl (aq) is 200 kJ/mol.
